book.description: The FlexUnit ActionScript 3 API Reference provides syntax, usage information, and code examples for every element in the FlexUnit ActionScript 3 library.

all-packages.description: All Packages detailed description. Content TBD.

all-classes.description: Documentation for classes includes syntax, usage information, and code samples for methods, properties, and event handlers and listeners for MXML classes and for those APIs that belong to a specific class in ActionScript (as opposed to global functions or properties). The classes are listed alphabetically. If you are not sure to which class a certain method or property belongs, you can look it up in the Index.

deprecated.shortDescription: A list of deprecated items and suggested alternatives when available.
deprecated.description: The evolution of ActionScript has deprecated many elements of the language. This section lists the deprecated items and suggests alternatives when available. While deprecated elements still work, Macromedia recommends that you do not continue using deprecated elements in your code. Support of deprecated elements in the future is not guaranteed.

mxmlOnly.shortDescription: Short description of mxml only classes, content TBD.
mxmlOnly.description: Detailed description of mxml only classes. Content TBD.

package.name: org.seasar.flex2.net
package.shortDescription: The org.seasar.flex2.net package contains the classes to support data formatting.
package.description: The org.seasar.flex2.net package contains the classes to support data formatting.

package.name: org.seasar.flex2.rpc
package.shortDescription: The org.seasar.flex2.rpc package contains the classes to support data validation.
package.description: The org.seasar.flex2.rpc package contains the classes to support data validation.

package.name: org.seasar.flex2.rpc.remoting
package.shortDescription: The org.seasar.flex2.rpc.remoting package contains the classes to support behaviors.
package.description: The org.seasar.flex2.rpc.remoting package contains the classes to support behaviors.
